messages.subject: "secrets" (was Re: Question)
messages.msgSnippet: In a message dated 6/21/05 3:03:03 PM, debra.rossing@mastercam.com writes:
messages.messageBody:
In a message dated 6/21/05 3:03:03 PM, debra.rossing@... writes:

<< To protect your privacy, you may also want to add "All

information provided herein is considered privileged and

confidential. Any further disclosure of this information requires

written parental consent prior to such disclosure." >>

Wanted to add here that one reason that irks me is that sometimes people will
send e-mail and say "this may not be repeated."

Sorry, that's bullshit.

Unless I agree in advance, what shows up in my e-mail or my mailbox is mine.
If I want to print it out and stick it on my front door, I can do that.

It's like a little kid saying "I'm going to tell you a secret and then you
can't tell anyone, but I broke a window."

Wrong-o. If it's my window and I didn't agree in advance to hear and
protect a secret, it's not a secret.

Sandra
